skill.name: docusaurus-deployer
skill.description: This skill should be used when deploying a Docusaurus site to GitHub Pages. It automates the configuration, building, and deployment process, handling GitHub Pages setup, environment configuration, and CI/CD automation. Includes local validation before GitHub Actions triggering.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when deploying a Docusaurus site to GitHub Pages. It automates the configu...
skill.author: 92Bilal26

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill providing Docusaurus deployment guides and templates. All 385 static findings are false positives - they flag example commands and configuration in markdown documentation, not executable code. No actual network calls, credential access, or code execution occurs. Prior audit confirmed safe rating.

content.value_statement: Deploying Docusaurus documentation to GitHub Pages requires configuring build settings, GitHub Actions workflows, and deployment branches. This skill automates the entire process with pre-validated templates and local testing before CI/CD triggers.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes Docusaurus project structure and validates configuration files
Validates docusaurus.config.ts and sidebars.ts before deployment
Provides GitHub Actions workflow template for automated deployment
Guides local build and testing before pushing to repository
Configures GitHub Pages settings for user and project pages
Troubleshoots common deployment issues like 404 errors and build failures
limitations: Does not modify user files directly; provides guidance for manual changes
Requires user to have GitHub repository already created
Does not handle custom domain DNS configuration
Cannot resolve content-specific issues like broken internal links in markdown files

use_cases.title: First-time Documentation Setup
use_cases.description: Configure and deploy a new Docusaurus site to GitHub Pages with proper CI/CD automation.

use_cases.title: CI/CD Pipeline Creation
use_cases.description: Set up automated GitHub Actions workflows that build and deploy documentation on every push.

use_cases.title: Deployment Troubleshooting
use_cases.description: Diagnose and fix common issues like build failures, 404 errors, and broken links in deployed documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic deployment
prompt_templates.prompt: Deploy my Docusaurus site to GitHub Pages. My repository is at github.com/username/repo-name and the Docusaurus files are in the docs/ directory.

prompt_templates.title: CI/CD setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a GitHub Actions workflow for deploying my Docusaurus documentation. I want it to build automatically when I push to main branch.

prompt_templates.title: Configuration check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if my Docusaurus configuration is correct for GitHub Pages deployment. My docusaurus.config.ts is at docs/docusaurus.config.ts.

prompt_templates.title: Fix deployment issues
prompt_templates.prompt: My Docusaurus site shows 404 errors after deployment. The site builds successfully locally but not on GitHub Pages. Help me troubleshoot.

output_examples.input: Deploy my Docusaurus documentation to GitHub Pages for the first time
output: I will help you deploy your Docusaurus site to GitHub Pages.
Step 1: Project Analysis
I will examine your Docusaurus structure to verify docusaurus.config.ts, sidebars.ts, and package.json.
Step 2: Configuration Validation
Check your settings for GitHub Pages compatibility (url, baseUrl, organizationName, projectName).
Step 3: Local Testing
Run npm ci, npm run typecheck, npm run build, and npm run serve to validate before pushing.
Step 4: CI/CD Setup
Create .github/workflows/deploy.yml using the official GitHub Actions for Pages deployment.
Step 5: Repository Configuration
Guide you through GitHub Pages settings to enable deployment from GitHub Actions.
What is your Docusaurus project location and GitHub repository URL?

output_examples.input: Create a GitHub Actions workflow for my Docusaurus site
output: I will create a GitHub Actions workflow for automated Docusaurus deployment.
The workflow will:
- Trigger on push to main branch
- Use Node.js v20 with npm caching
- Run npm ci for clean dependency installation
- Execute npm run typecheck for TypeScript validation
- Build the site with npm run build
- Deploy using actions/deploy-pages@v4
Required setup in your repository:
1. Create .github/workflows/deploy.yml
2. Enable GitHub Pages in repository settings
3. Set deployment source to GitHub Actions
Would you like me to create the deploy.yml file now?

best_practices: Always run local validation (typecheck, build, serve) before pushing changes to catch errors early
Use relative links in documentation instead of hardcoded URLs to ensure correct navigation on GitHub Pages
Configure branch protection rules to require successful CI/CD runs before merging changes
anti_patterns: Deploying without local testing leads to failed CI/CD runs and broken documentation
Using hardcoded URLs in markdown files instead of relative paths causes broken navigation
Skipping the npm run typecheck step causes TypeScript errors to fail the build in CI/CD

faq.question: What Node.js version does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill supports Node.js v20 and above, matching Docusaurus requirements. The workflow uses Node 20 by default.

faq.question: What is the difference between user pages and project pages?
faq.answer: User pages deploy from the main branch root. Project pages deploy from the gh-pages branch and require baseUrl to include the repository name.

faq.question: How do I integrate this skill with existing CI/CD?
faq.answer: Add the deploy.yml workflow to your .github/workflows directory. It triggers on pushes to main and uses official GitHub Actions for Pages deployment.

faq.question: Is my data safe during deployment?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads configuration files and creates deployment workflows. No data is sent to external services beyond standard GitHub API calls.

faq.question: Why does my site show 404 after successful deployment?
faq.answer: Common causes are incorrect baseUrl configuration, missing trailing slash for project pages, or GitHub Pages settings pointing to the wrong branch or source.

faq.question: How does this compare to other deployment methods?
faq.answer: This skill uses GitHub Actions, which is the recommended approach. Alternative methods include manual gh-pages branch deployment or third-party CI services.
